titleStmt.title: Heras' census declaration
titleStmt.author: Heras, Daughter of Lysimachos and Tamystha, granddaughter of Herodion

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: Copy of a registration. To Maximus also called Nearchos, strategos, and Herakleides, Basilikos grammateus of the division of Herakleides in the Arsinoite nome, and to Sabinos and Antoninus, scribes of the metropolis, and to the amphodarch and registrar of the Linen-factories' quarter, from Heras daughter of Lysimachos son of Herodion, her mother being Tamystha, enrolled in the quarter of the Hawk-shrine of Apollonios, with my guardian my kinsman Herakleides son of Patron. I own in the quarter of Moeris a two-thirds share of a house and court and grounds, in which I register the following inmates for the house-to-house registration of the past 9th year of Antoninus Caesar the Lord at the Linen-factories' quarter, at which I was also registered ï¿½ (Here the papyrus breaks off)

listBibl.bibl: P.Tebt., II.321 Census publications: R.S. Bagnall & B.W. Frier, The demography of Roman Egypt. Cambridge ; New York : Cambridge University Press, 1994.
